- Let's start with the physician, right?
So in the United States specifically,

especially coming out
of COVID and even before

there's been a big issue
around clinician burnout.

And that clinician burnout
comes from like meaningful use.

When we went all digital and
everything went into the EHR,

instead of reducing the
workload for those clinicians,
we actually increased it.

And so not only do we have
that burnout issue where,
you've got people leaving the industry

'Cause again, they're in the

for every patient that they see,
they sit in front of a computer,

oftentimes just entering
notes from the engagement.
The next actions be it labs
or additional testing, any prescriptions.
They spend a lot of time.

And when you think about
clinical documentation

or ambient documentation
where you've got technology

can identify the difference
between a patient

and a physician, they can
start a lot of that coding
for that physician.

So they don't have to spend
that minute for minute
for every patient.
And it's the old saying in healthcare,

out over an entire year,

over an entire healthcare
organization, it's significant.

not only are they using

a lot of the technology AI
ML to predict the outcome

digital by itself, doesn't

How many people actually

Because there's nobody there

what if I know that your DNA makeup
